metadata.Title: CVE-2015-2666 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the get_matching_model_microcode function in arch/x86/kernel/cpu/microcode/intel_early.c in the Linux kernel before 4.0 allows context-dependent attackers to gain privileges by constructing a crafted microcode header and leveraging root privileges for write access to the initrd. A stack overflow was discovered in the the microcode loader for the intel x86 platform. A local attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (kernel crash) or to potentially execute code with kernel privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2666` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:
